legal_disclaimers.title: Legal Disclaimers
legal_disclaimers.subtitle: Important legal information regarding the use of the Buró Reputacional Ciudadano (BRC) platform

1.title: 1. General Disclaimer
1.text: The Buró Reputacional Ciudadano (BRC) is a civil justice platform where citizens can document personal, community, or systemic injustices. BRC is not a court of law, government agency, or official judicial body. The information contained on this platform represents user-submitted documentation and does not constitute legal findings or determinations of fact.

2.title: 2. Nature of Content
2.text: All case documentation, reports, and evidence submitted to BRC are provided by users of the platform. BRC does not independently verify the accuracy, completeness, or veracity of user-submitted content unless explicitly stated. Users are solely responsible for the content they submit.

3.title: 3. No Legal Advice
3.text: The materials and information on this platform are provided for informational purposes only and do not constitute legal advice. BRC is not a law firm and does not provide legal services or representation. Users should consult with qualified legal professionals for specific legal advice.

4.title: 4. Limitation of Liability
4.text: BRC shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or exemplary damages resulting from: The use or inability to use the service; Unauthorized access to or alteration of your transmissions or data; Statements or conduct of any third party on the service; Any other matter relating to the service.

5.title: 5. User Responsibilities
5.text: By using this platform, you agree: To provide accurate and truthful information in your submissions; Not to submit defamatory, libelous, or knowingly false information; To comply with all applicable laws and regulations; To respect the privacy and rights of others.

6.title: 6. Intellectual Property
6.text: All content submitted to BRC remains the intellectual property of the original submitter. By submitting content, users grant BRC a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free license to use, display, and distribute the content in connection with the platform's operations.

7.title: 7. Right to Response
7.text: Individuals named in case documentation have the right to submit responses or rebuttals, which will be published alongside the original content in accordance with our policies.

8.title: 8. Content Moderation
8.text: BRC reserves the right to remove or modify any content that violates our terms of service or community guidelines, including but not limited to content that is unlawful, threatening, abusive, harassing, defamatory, or otherwise objectionable.

9.title: 9. Jurisdiction
9.text: These terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Texas, USA, without regard to conflict of law provisions. Any legal action related to these terms or use of the platform shall be brought exclusively before the competent courts of Texas, USA

overviews.title: GDPR Overview
overviews.description: Regulates data protection and privacy for individuals within the European Union and European Economic Area.

Case Documentation: Information submitted in reputational cases

sarmiento_case.legal_notice: This platform does not issue legal judgments. It documents citizen reports with supporting evidence and offers full right of reply. The individuals mentioned are presumed innocent. This is a transparency and prevention tool.
sarmiento_case.relationship_beginning_text: This relationship started as a friendship when the complainant was beginning a construction project. Three lump-sum, time-bound contracts were signed.
sarmiento_case.conflict_text: Despite a fixed-price, fixed-term contract, he unjustifiably demanded more money. He had done full due diligence before signing, and third-party experts confirmed the info provided was more than sufficient. Other bidders even quoted lower prices.
sarmiento_case.demands_text: He demanded additional payments without justification, even after signing a settlement agreement.
sarmiento_case.threats_text: Two years later, threats and intimidating messages began, including social media posts.
sarmiento_case.impact_text: Threats and defamation included family members (children, wife, mother), professional reputation, and social standing.
sarmiento_case.contact_text: Contact information is kept confidential and only shared with authorized parties for verification purposes.

legal_ethics.meta_description: Legal and Ethical Standards for the Behavioral Risk Check (BRC)
legal_ethics.title: Legal Ethics Statement
legal_ethics.subtitle: Our commitment to ethical standards in documentation and reputational justice

principles.title: 1. Foundational Principles
principles.description: The Behavioral Risk Check (BRC) operates under these core ethical principles that guide all our activities and platform operations:

items.title: Truth & Accuracy
items.description: We prioritize factual accuracy and require verifiable evidence for all submissions, while acknowledging the complexity of truth in reputational matters.

items.title: Due Process
items.description: All subjects of documentation receive notice and opportunity to respond before publication, with clear procedures for rebuttal and appeal.

items.title: Proportionality
items.description: We assess the severity of claims against available evidence, ensuring documentation reflects appropriate scope and context.

items.title: Public Interest
items.description: Documentation serves legitimate civic purposes - exposing misconduct, protecting communities, and promoting accountability.

documentation_standards.title: 2. Documentation Standards
documentation_standards.description: All case documentation must meet these ethical standards:
items: Verification: Submitters must provide supporting evidence for factual claims
Context: Documentation must include relevant background and circumstances
Balance: Submitters should acknowledge any contradictory evidence
Privacy: Personal information not relevant to the case should be redacted
Timeliness: Documentation should reflect current information or clearly note historical context

right_to_response.title: 3. Right to Response
right_to_response.description: We uphold these ethical practices regarding responses:
items: Subjects receive notification before publication with clear response instructions
Responses receive equal prominence to original documentation
We facilitate mediation in cases of factual disputes
Corrections are published promptly with clear change documentation

moderation_ethics.title: 4. Moderation Ethics
moderation_ethics.description: Our content moderation follows these principles:
items: Transparency in moderation decisions and criteria
Consistency in applying platform rules
Opportunity for appeal of moderation decisions
Protection against misuse while preserving legitimate documentation
Regular review of moderation practices by independent ethics advisors

conflict_of_interest.title: 5. Conflict of Interest
conflict_of_interest.description: We maintain strict policies regarding conflicts:
items: Staff and reviewers must disclose potential conflicts
Cases involving BRC personnel receive independent review
Funding sources are transparent and do not influence case documentation
No paid removals or alterations of documentation

continuous_improvement.title: 6. Continuous Improvement
items: Annual ethics reviews by external experts
Public comment periods for policy changes
Case studies of ethical dilemmas for staff training
Transparent reporting on ethical challenges faced

contact.title: Ethics Committee Contact
contact.description: To report ethical concerns or seek guidance:

warning.title: Important Legal Information
warning.description: This registry is of civic nature and public interest:
items: All submissions must be supported by verifiable evidence
Subjects have the right to reply to any allegations
False or misleading submissions may have legal consequences
This platform does not replace official legal proceedings

privacy_notice_gdpr.meta_description: How we collect, use, and protect your personal data in compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
privacy_notice_gdpr.title: Privacy Notice (GDPR)
privacy_notice_gdpr.subtitle: How we collect, use, and protect your personal data in compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation

1.title: 1. Data Controller Information
1.text: The Behavioral Risk Check (BRC) is the data controller responsible for your personal data.

2.title: 2. Information We Collect
2.text: We may collect and process the following categories of personal data:

list.identity: Identity Data: Name, username, or similar identifier
list.contact: Contact Data: Email address, telephone numbers, postal address
list.case: Case Data: Information submitted when documenting cases

3.title: 3. How We Use Your Data
3.text: We will only use your personal data when the law allows us to. Most commonly, we will use your data in the following circumstances:

list.register: To register you as a user of our platform
list.process: To process and document cases of reputational concern
list.manage: To manage our relationship with you
list.admin: To administer and protect our platform
list.analytics: To use data analytics to improve our platform

4.title: 4. Legal Basis for Processing
4.text: Under GDPR, we rely on the following legal bases for processing personal data:

list.consent: Consent: When you have given clear consent
list.contract: Contract: When processing is necessary for a contract
list.legal_obligation: Legal Obligation: When processing is required by law
list.legitimate_interests: Legitimate Interests: When processing is necessary for our legitimate interests
list.public_interest: Public Interest: When processing is necessary for a task carried out in the public interest

5.title: 5. Data Sharing and Transfers
5.text: We may share your personal data with the following parties:

list.service_providers: Service providers who provide IT and system administration services
list.advisers: Professional advisers including lawyers, bankers, and insurers
list.government: Government bodies that require us to report processing activities
list.third_parties: Third parties to whom we may choose to transfer parts of our operations

5.note: We require all third parties to respect the security of your personal data and to treat it in accordance with the law.

6.title: 6. Data Security
6.text: We have implemented appropriate security measures to prevent your personal data from being accidentally lost, used, or accessed in an unauthorized way. These include:

list.encryption: Encryption of data in transit and at rest
list.assessments: Regular security assessments and penetration testing

7.title: 7. Data Retention
7.text: We will only retain your personal data for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes we collected it for, including for the purposes of satisfying any legal, accounting, or reporting requirements.

list.user_accounts: User accounts: 5 years after last activity
list.case_docs: Case documentation: 10 years from case closure
list.financial: Financial records: 7 years for tax purposes

8.title: 8. Your Legal Rights
8.text: Under GDPR, you have rights including:

list.access: Right to access: Request copies of your personal data
list.rectification: Right to rectification: Request correction of inaccurate data
list.erasure: Right to erasure: Request deletion of your personal data
list.restrict: Right to restrict processing: Request limitation of processing
list.portability: Right to data portability: Request transfer of your data
list.object: Right to object: Object to certain types of processing
list.withdraw: Right to withdraw consent: Withdraw consent at any time

8.note: To exercise any of these rights, please contact our Data Protection Officer.

9.title: 9. Changes to This Notice
9.text: We may update this privacy notice from time to time. The current version will always be posted on our website with an updated revision date.

contact.text: For questions about this privacy notice or our data practices, please contact:
